analysis.key_quote: The existing merit based civil service laws protect the People of the United States against damaging and unprofessional wholesale changes to their federal government workforce caused by loss of employees first hired with the best available demonstrated qualification for the job and their subsequent on-the-job developed skills and institutional knowledge.
analysis.rationale: The comment opposes the proposed rule by emphasizing the importance of merit-based civil service laws and the risks of politicization, which could lead to the loss of skilled employees and institutional knowledge.
